content.raw:
The main idea was to have interaction with the simulation without having the simulator installed (i.e. having the client running in the browser and sending msg via nodejs). However then I noticed GazeboJs doesn't support different servers, doesn't take into account GAZEBO_MASTER_URI variable. I wrote Ian Chen about it, and I guess that's why Issue 5 appeared (which for some reason I cannot view, and also I cannot create issues for the gazebojs branch, maybe look into that as well?).
So coming back to the description, should I wait until different servers are supported and then update the description? We can also change the tutorial then to make it run with gzweb.
content.html: The main idea was to have interaction with the simulation without having the simulator installed (i.e. having the client running in the browser and sending msg via nodejs). However then I noticed GazeboJs doesn't support different servers, doesn't take into account GAZEBO_MASTER_URI variable. I wrote Ian Chen about it, and I guess that's why Issue 5 appeared (which for some reason I cannot view, and also I cannot create issues for the gazebojs branch, maybe look into that as well?). So coming back to the description, should I wait until different servers are supported and then update the description? We can also change the tutorial then to make it run with gzweb.
